intro: Dissocarpus fontinalis, commonly known as the water clubmoss, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves and a short, upright stem. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and wetlands. Its reproductive structures include sporangia that produce spores for propagation. Dissocarpus fontinalis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
